name: Egypt to Athens
description: Primary grain route from Egypt. Affected by Etesian winds (July-September) which facilitate northward sailing. Nile flood variability impacts grain availability.

name: Black Sea to Athens
description: Black Sea grain route via Byzantium. Weather conditions in the Bosporus and Hellespont critical. Seasonal winds affect passage.

name: Sicily to Athens
description: Sicilian grain route. Affected by Mediterranean weather patterns and volcanic activity (e.g., Etna). Etesian winds can assist or hinder depending on timing.

name: Cyrene to Athens
description: North African grain route. Arid climate makes production sensitive to rainfall. Etesian winds affect shipping timing and routes.

name: Phoenicia to Athens
description: Phoenician grain route. Weather patterns along the Levantine coast affect shipping. Etesian winds influence Aegean passage.
